Description: Red granite seated statue of a man and wife; legs lost; hieroglyphic text including the prenomen and Horus-name of Osorkon III and identifying a man (name lost) as priest of Amun and his wife as Ankhesenast; the inscription is Third Intermediate Period, the statue probably 18th Dynasty.
Curator's comments: PM II (2): p.289 To be published by Karl Jansen-Winkeln

Publication of texts: Karl Jansen-Winkeln, Inschriften der Spätzeit. Teil II: Die 22.-24. Dynastie, Wiesbaden 2007, p. 153 (18.89). Publication with photos and drawings: Helmut Brandl, Untersuchungen zur Privatplastik der Dritten Zwischenzeit: Typologie - Ikonographie - Stilistik, Berlin 2008, pp. 235-236, p. 399 fig. 69, p. 456 fig. 100, pp. 473-474 fig. 105, pl. 127.
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ankhesenast (woman in dyad)
